root: ^“Good Morning, am I the first one here?”
^You consider the early hour, thinking back to the start of your shift.
^“I’ve seen other guests come through today.”

option1: ^“That’s just great. This could be a big problem.”
^“Why does trouble always seem to follow my vacation leave…”
option2: ^“Excuse me? You’re far too nosy for a receptionist.”
^“There are better things to do than pry into guests' personal matters.”
^“In regards to your question, I get up when I please. Happy now?”
^You crack a small smile, which he doesn’t seem to find amusing.
option3: ^“Splendid. There may still be time yet to fix this.”
^“My early tendencies have always served me well.”
lastnight: ^“Enough with the small talk, let's address the matter at hand.”
^“Although, it’s not like you seemed to be doing much before I arrived.”
^“I just have one little inquiry. Then I’ll be on my way.”
^You feel like he seems hesitant to ask you whatever is on his mind.
^“Has…anyone else checked in since last night?”
^“They would be wearing a tie of some sort, if that helps at all.”
^You try to recall the events of last night. Is it wise to be spilling company info to strangers?
^“I can’t tell you that. Receptionist's honor!”
lastnight1: ^“Seriously? Is that what you call customer service in this part of the woods?”
^“I can’t believe I have to figure this out on my own…”
lastnight2: ^“You were the last guest to check in.”
^Well.. apart from that frazzled reptile woman. That doesn’t seem to be who he’s looking for though.
managerlocation: ^They look around the lobby with a concerned expression.
^“I knew I shouldn’t have flown in. They can never keep up with me…”
^“Ok. Calm. A welcome break, peace and quiet. This will be good for you.”
^“Is there anything I can help with?”
managerloc1: ^“Not that you can help with, no. You’ve done enough already.”
^“I need a cup of coffee. Where is the machine?”
^You point him in the direction of the coffee station. By the time your hand is raised, he’s already halfway down the corridor…
managerloc2: ^“Damn manager. My publishers won’t like a word of this.”
^“I need to go back to my room and make some calls.”
^He doesn’t appear to be paying attention to you any more.
sc1end: ^Well…that was pretty peculiar. Maybe he will return later?
